model

Class Account

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.Account
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Account401K, Account403B, AccountCashBalance, AccountIra, AccountRoth, Brokerage, Deductions, Execute, Expenses, Pension, Salary, SocialSecurity, Taxes

    public class Account
extends Object
    Helper routines for the accounts.
    Version:
    release-1.0.0 Initial version
    Author:
    D.K.Sweeney 1/12/2016

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize(double balance,
                       double growthRate,
                       int currentAge,
                       int currentYear,
                       int deathAge)
        This method builds the initial data structure.
        Parameters:
        balance - The current account balance.
        growthRate - The expected yearly growth rate of the account.
        currentAge - The current age of the person
        currentYear - The current year of the person owning the account
        deathAge - The expected death age of the person

        public void computeGrowth(int currentYear,
                          int currentAge,

        Build the data structure
        Parameters:
        currentYear - The simulation year
        currentAge - The age at each year
        numberOfYears - The number of years in the data structure

      • recomputeGrowthWithDeposit

        public void recomputeGrowthWithDeposit(int currentAge,
                                       double deposit)
        Recalculates the values in the data structure based on the deposit Assumes that the deposit is in the middle of the year
        Parameters:
        currentAge - Value to compute from
        deposit - Dollar amount

      • recomputeGrowthWithWithdrawal

        public void recomputeGrowthWithWithdrawal(int currentAge,
                                          double withdrawal)
        Recalculates the values in the data structure based on the withdrawal Assumes that the withdrawal is at the beginning of the year
        Parameters:
        currentAge - Value to compute from
        withdrawal - Dollar amount

      • zeroAllEndingValues

        public void zeroAllEndingValues()
        Sets all the nodes in the data structure to zero

      • withdraw

        public double withdraw(int currentAge,
                       double amount)
        Withdraw a certain amount if the account has amount in it (or the remaining value) and recompute the balance for the remaining years of the account. Assumes that the withdrawal was made at the beginning of the year.
        Parameters:
        currentAge - The age of the person at the withdrawal year
        amount - The requested amount of the withdrawal
        Returns:
        The amount actually withdrawn

      • deposit

        public void deposit(int currentAge,
                    double deposit)
        Deposit an amount and recompute the balance for the remaining years of the account (Assumes the deposit is at the middle of the year)
        Parameters:
        currentAge - The age of the person at the deposit year
        deposit - The amount of the deposit

      • computePeriodicWithdrawalsRegardlessOfAge

        public void computePeriodicWithdrawalsRegardlessOfAge(int currentAge,
                                                      int withdrawalNumber,
                                                      int NumberOfWithdrawals)
        Set withdrawals based on age and numberOfwithdrawals.
        Parameters:
        currentAge - The age of the person at the start of the simulation
        withdrawalNumber - The current withdrawal number
        NumberOfWithdrawals - The number of withdrawals specified

      • computePeriodicWithdrawals

        public void computePeriodicWithdrawals(int currentAge,
                                       double growthRate,
                                       int startWithdrawalsAge,
                                       int numberOfWithdrawals)
        Set withdrawals based on age and numberOfwithdrawals.
        Parameters:
        currentAge - The age of the person at the start of the simulation
        growthRate - The of the account
        startWithdrawalsAge - The age to start the withdrawals
        numberOfWithdrawals - The number of years
